main event: Multiple sightings of unconventional aircraft over Unalakleet, Alaska in January 1951.
interesting points: Three targets were picked up by radar and observed maneuvering sharply without changing speed at approximately 500 mph.
Ground radar estimated the objects to be at 40,000 feet in altitude.
Initial time of pick-up was 1045 EST, 24 January 1951, and the length of observation was estimated at 10 to 30 minutes.

An outgoing classified message from the Alaskan Command Joint Communication Center reported the observation of lights in the sky by two Alaskan native boys, which was later speculated to be two C-47 aircraft engaged in routine training flights.
The report mentions the possibility of the sighting being a reflection from the sun beyond the horizon or a possible submarine.
witnesses: multiple witnesses, including Alaskan native boys
